column4: 8.10 (II), how do I set a static IP and make it so that NetworkManager doesn't try to disconnect and reconnect on login?  [all wired, no wireless, auto-boots after power outages (often), nothing network needs to be user configured]
-> put them in  /etc/network/interfaces    also man interfaces
- i did that,  networkmanager still fights and reconnects them as dhcp
-> post your /etc/network/interfaces file and lets see
- pastebin or #flood?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/91885/
- see anything wrong?
-> sorry, i stepped out, did you paste anything?
- yup
http://paste.ubuntu.com/91885/

-> you wanted it active at boot time?  add  auto eth0  at end of section,  also do not have two interfaces on at same time on same subnet with same ip adress range, your host will get confuse as to which nic to take to the gateway
-> decide either eth0 or eth1 you will use - one at a time
- i had no problems with that style connection on sarge
-> well you will with ubuntu, am surprised your sarge is not confused, with two paths to same gateway
- it was fine with it, i think it actually was load balanced and fallover on fail... forget the exact settings, that machine died [and is why i bought the one in question here].  BRB, rebooting
- ok, i had to disable NetworkManager as well to get it to work, but it appears to be working now
-> am glad it worked for you
-> i believe the uri is  ipp://
-> i believe the uri is  ipp://ipaddressofyourubuntu

there's a resource after that apparently... I found a way to pull it, apparently it is ipp://ip/printer/PrinterNameThatYouNeverSeeEvenInTheConfigPageHere , but that doesn't explain how to find it through proper means
-> i dont know if anyone can easily find it lest the adminstrator of that shared printer tells you, its not like broadcasted to everyone so they cna use it
i am the administrator of it.
